fields.headline: In brief
fields.bodyText: Safari cancelled Travelbag Adventures have had to cancel their first gorilla safari of the season, later this month, to Uganda because of potential threat to tourists in the Bwindi National Park from rebels in the neighbouring Democratic Republic of Congo. Adventures managing director Mark Wright said: "Although there have not been any incidents involving tourists, we are taking no risks. All clients have been offered a refund or offered another trip on one of our safaris in Tanzania or Botswana. We hope to resume our programme at the end of July. We are continuing to monitor the situation." * The foreign office are still telling tourists to avoid Nepal. Malta on the ball Gary Neville, the Manchester United star, has signed a two-year deal with the Malta Tourism Authority and Air Malta to promote the island in the UK. Neville is launching a soccer school on the island this month. Malta has one of the largest Manchester United supporters club outside the UK. Malta Tourism Authority (020-7292 4900, www.visitmalta.com). Bath on wheels A new guide, Cycling in Bath and beyond, has been published by the Bath Tourism and Conference Bureau. The five routes range from 13 to 30 miles. The weatherproof maps cost £4.50 inc p&p from Bath Tourist Information Centre (01225 477708, tourism@bathnes.gov.uk). Fly from Bristol Go, the low-cost airline, has announced three new daily destinations from Bristol. They are Edinburgh, Glasgow and Belfast, and fares range from £45 to £150 return (0870 6076543, www.go-fly.com). Foreign dangers A leaflet warning holidaymakers of the serious consequences of getting into trouble abroad and how to avoid this has been produced by Prisoners Abroad (020-7561 6834, www.prisonersabroad.org.uk). Gorillas on the Net Webcams have been installed in the gorilla enclosures at Chessington World of Adventures park in Surrey. Viewing at www.bbc.co.uk/nature/animals/webcams . Highland line The brown trout angling available in the northern Highlands of Scotland is highlighted in a new leaflet and website launched by the Caithness and Sutherland Trout Angling Group. Head North to an Angling Paradise is available free (01463 715225, www.fishing-highland.co.uk).
